===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=いもり|井|tr1=i|t1=well|守り|tr2=mori|t2=protector, guardian|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|守る}} ''moru'', “to protect, to guard”}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|いもり|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|蠑螈}} {{qualifier|only refers to the animal, not the job}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|いもり|イモリ|hhira=ゐもり}}

# a [[salamander]], a [[newt]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=いもり|obsolete}} a [[job]] [[title]] in the {{w|Edo period}} and earlier, referring to an assistant to the {{m|ja|井司|tr=ishi|lit=well boss}}, both jobs in charge of aspects of the [[irrigation]] [[system]]
